sect1.title: git merge and Related Commands
sect1.para: git merge. This is useful to apply changes from another branch (or several branches) to the current one. By default the resulting changes are committed. This can be prevented with the --no-commit option, which allows to review the changes, and possibly reset some of them.
In some cases, merging results in conflicts that have to be manually resolved. Note that it is recommended to merge only to a clean branch, that is after committing all changes.

note.title: Note to Subversion Users
note.para: Contrary to subversion, there is no --dry-run option to git merge. But a repository can always be reset to a previous state with git reset --hard <commit>.
